website_summaries.verdict: The Merrell All Out Crush 2 received quite a positive response from trail running enthusiasts who wanted dependable surface traction and agreeable in-shoe coverage. Most of those who have tested this neutral shoe liked its lightweight build, as well. Conversely, several people griped about its sizing scheme and its unstable interior fit.
pros: Many people felt that the Merrell All Out Crush 2 was comfortable
The upper was lauded for preventing trail debris and soil from infiltrating the interior foot-chamber
Many consumers appreciated the grip of the outsole on soft surfaces and rocks
Most runners liked the lightweight nature of this running shoe
The spacious toe box allowed natural toe-splay, based on several reviews
The durability of the materials used for the All Out Crush 2 was deemed reliable
cons: According to a tester, the lightness of this product was a catalyst for in-shoe wobbling and foot instability

customer_reviews.title: More than happy!
customer_reviews.text: There super light and feel well made. I've done a few 5/6 milers with them and they have held up. They have good grip but in the really soft sticky mudd they kind of glog up... But I think this will happen with any trainer. just remember not to walk around a showroom after doing a muddy run!!! The carpet was in a bit of a mess 😳. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan P.

customer_reviews.title: Worth a go
customer_reviews.text: They fit quite narrow at the front but due to limited cushioning on the uppers which I was specifically looking for they have a slightly loose fit around the ankles. The heel is quite high as well which can feel like it is digging in a little when you are running on an uneven surface. However completed a solid half marathon in them and no real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: George Pettingell

customer_reviews.title: They are better than you might think.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a muddy assault run - I did not expect much. It was the worse weather I have ever been out in! They held up great. Good grip and as comfortable as they could be without holding water. Very pleased with em!
customer_reviews.author: J.E.MURPHY

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is lovely but not durable
customer_reviews.text: Very breathable shoe and I loved it. Very good grip and did what they needed to do. The problem is a hole appearing at the front of the shoe and getting larger with less than one weeks use.
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Tip top
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to go running on bridle ways etc and have turned out to be really good given the very recent weather. They dry quickly, are light and fit well as you’d expect from merrel.
customer_reviews.author: rob mills

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of trainers. I completed a tough mudder in these and they were ideal
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. T. Radford

customer_reviews.title: Bees knees
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is one of the best...its very light,grippy and vented...which basically let's water or sand rush out . Fit is spot on. Been long time since trusted pair of off road shoes
customer_reviews.author: robbie p

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and grip.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted for my rat race adventure races. Water drains out nicely after you have to swim in them too :-) These are my second pair so that I can use them for boot camps too.
customer_reviews.author: Lordi

customer_reviews.title: Best for cross country
customer_reviews.text: Used these for tough mudder and they were brilliant for cross country, grip was amazing
customer_reviews.author: matthew coulson

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: Saw these at a great price. Was worried as some people said they were too narrow but I’m a 10 and these fit nicely. Not submerged them in water yet but so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Brad Frankland

customer_reviews.title: Tough Mudder Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Used these for a classic 10 mile tough mudder, perfect for the event. Great grip and comfort- a must have for any mud related event! Ran past so many people slipping and sliding about on normal trainers, these shoes saved me!
customer_reviews.author: John Harrod

customer_reviews.title: Solid yet lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and light. Great fit and the tread provides excellent grip on the muddy trails I use. Nice quality feel to them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Devine

customer_reviews.title: not sure till l go out in them
customer_reviews.text: light shoe not worn yet will use for trail running
customer_reviews.author: anthony bain

customer_reviews.title: Slippery when wet
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and ok in the dry, very slippery on wet stone and paved surfaces
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: No arch support whatsoever.
customer_reviews.text: The left shoe feels as if the inside of the sole is very soft and makes u feel you are walking in the inside of your foot.
customer_reviews.author: S & L Lubwama

customer_reviews.title: Good fit but not too durable
customer_reviews.text: Having only wore these twice, they are already starting to show signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C

customer_reviews.title: Great for obstacle races.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for Tough Mudder. Previously, I had used trainers but was advised to use these. These are awesome and make obstacles like the mud mile a breeze. Avoids that slipping around you get with trainers. If you do obstacle races you needs these.
customer_reviews.author: Mr A K Chauhan

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Best trail shoes that I have ever bought.. light and comfy great in the wet as well. Well worth the money..
customer_reviews.author: Richard millns

customer_reviews.title: Ideal OCR shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of trail shoes, bought at a brilliant price. Bought my son these for OCR running, plenty of mud and water made his other shoes too heavy. The lugs are brilliant for grip in the mud and also ideal for climbing up walls, keeping grip on obstacles. These are light, let water, sand, mud etc out instead of keeping them in the shoes. I am so impressed I have bought myself a pair too.
customer_reviews.author: Jedi maw

customer_reviews.title: Lighweight flexible running shoe
customer_reviews.text: The all out crush range is how merrell used to be. The shoe is a good fit, although i marked it slightly larger than expected this is because in recent years i have found many merrell ranges a bit tight, so it is larger in comparison to these, so i regard as comfortable especially if you are running in them giving space for your feet to swell. Nice and lightweight and a good design
customer_reviews.author: chris c

customer_reviews.title: Very food for people with wide feet
customer_reviews.text: For some one with very wide feet these are a breath of fresh air. Just did tough mudder in them, by the end of it my feet were the only bits of me that weren't sore! Can be wide at the back, recomend wearing with late locks to pull in snug.
customer_reviews.author: Liam Mancey

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight trail shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight for a trail shoe. Not remotely waterproof. Tread is capable of support on most surfaces though feels a little skatey on wet road/pavement.
customer_reviews.author: K Ridley

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoe for larger sizes
customer_reviews.text: Review 150 miles in: Great trail running shoes that have performed well for me in a lot of conditions and terrains. In 12+ sizes, Merrell are by far the best choice and the only one that seem to get the width right (ie, there’s enough of it). These are holding up really well in my second summer of running trails in them and I hope Merrell continue to make them in the future. It would be great if they could branch out into road shoes too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chapman

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's All Out Crush 2 Shoes
product_meta.description: These All Out Crush 2 shoes from Merrell feature synthetic upper and manmade inner material. The outsole is made out of synthetic. These fast and versatile shoes grip, drain, and protects during the toughest of training challenges.
feature_bullets: TPU Overlays - Offer durability and help provide a snug fit.
Lycra Neoprene Heel Lining - Offers extreme comfort.
Trail Protect - Offers additional support off road.
EVA Midsole - Absorbs shock and impact forces.
